content: chain 26 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook and across do not f/o working off that chain chain 26 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook and across do not f/o work 5 more chains of 26 f/o and leave a long tail for sewing if you need extra help here is a video for it https //www youtube com/watch v=onym2c8c9mm&t=22s sweet oddity art 7 assembly head and body 1 sew the head to the body you may need to add more stuffing as you sew 2 take a long strand of white yarn and thread your needle insert the needle into a hole in between the eyes bring the needle to the lower corner of the eye wrap the needle around the outside of the eye insert the needle into a hole on the top of the eye pull a little tightly to create a highlight for the eye repeat for the 2nd eye sweet oddity art 8 muzzle 1 pin the muzzle onto the face between the eyes yes you stuff the muzzle the muzzle will start approximately between rounds 8 and 9 2 sew the muzzle onto the face arms 1 pin the arms onto the body approximately between rounds 14 and 15 2 sew the arms onto the body sweet oddity art 9 ears and horn 1 pin the ears on top of the head 2 sew the ears onto the head 3 pin the horn onto the head in front of the ears 4 sew the horn onto the head sweet oddity art 10 hair 1 pin a piece of the mane behind the horn going down the back of the head 2 sew the piece onto the head pin the 2nd piece underneath the 1st sew onto the head 3 wrap the tail into a circle and sew the top shut pin the tail onto the back of the body sew the tail onto the body sweet oddity art 11 sweet oddity art 12 extras 1 add some blush to the cheeks if you want with actual blush or pink crayon you have your finished unicorn thank you for your purchase if you have any questions or concerns please email me at sweetoddityart@gmail com or etsy convo me i will get back to you asap please share your finished unicorn with me as often as you want i love seeing them sweet oddity art 13 additional information how to work on the opposite side of the chain this is an example picture 1 work the indicated amount of stitches across the first side of your chain 2 turn the chain around and work the indicated amount on the opposite side of the chain 2 turn the chain around and work the indicated amount on the opposite side of the chain sweet oddity art 14 3 here is your finished round when you are working on the opposite side of the chain sweet oddity art 15
